Zero-Shot Prompting.description: Zero-shot prompting involves asking a language model to perform a task without providing any examples or specific instructions beforehand. Itâ€™s effective for straightforward tasks.

Few-Shot Prompting.description: Few-shot prompting provides a few examples to guide the model's understanding, enhancing accuracy for nuanced tasks.

Chain-of-Thought (CoT) Prompting.description: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting instructs a model to reason step-by-step, improving performance on complex tasks.

Meta-Prompting.description: Meta-Prompting uses a prompt to create another prompt that better aligns with a task, enhancing specificity and accuracy.

Self-Consistency Prompting.description: Consistency prompting ensures outputs are logically coherent across similar tasks, reducing variability.

Tree-of-Thought (ToT) Prompting.description: Tree-of-Thought (ToT) prompting guides the model through multiple thought paths, promoting creative thinking.
